conclusion: Analyze paths from points A, B, C, and D to containers E, F, and G.
A is connected to a green bar.
The green bar is positioned above the red container (E).
Liquid from A will flow into container E.
B is connected to a gray bar.
The gray bar is positioned above the gray container (F).
Liquid from B will flow into container F.
C is connected to a purple bar.
The purple bar is positioned above the cyan container (G).
Liquid from C will flow into container G.
D is connected to a pink bar.
The pink bar is positioned above the orange container (G).
Liquid from D will flow into container G.
Summary: Liquid from A flows into container E, B into F, C into G, and D into G.
Final Answer: Container E receives liquid from A, F from B, and G from both C and D.
